Message.Title: ChannelAdvisor Numbers Deceptive -Actually Down -40%
Message.Msg: ChannelAdvisor's numbers actually show that sales through its members is down 40% from last June of 2012. These numbers are from its members who are selling on Amazon or Ebay. They are derived through software, not through actual surveys(ChannelAdvisor is a software company only). In June of 2012, they showed sales increased by just under 50%, but kept dropping each month afterwards until hitting a low of 25% in May of 2013 and then rose to 30% in June. You need to understand that these are sales that result from someone going to Amazon to buy an item, but finding a used one or cheaper one at one of their vendors, buys that item instead to save money. These sales therefore take business from Amazon and shift it to the other company who takes most of the money.

Message.Title: Latest News
Message.Msg: Still no order received from Amazon and we are at Day (28) since the order was placed and paid for. But my next problem is the piece of xxxx called AVG. For almost four years, I have bought their internet security two computers for two years. A few months ago they wanted to sell me the PC tuneup too. Why would I want to buy even more when AVG really doesn't work fast and does a good job. I get popup windows all time, and these discard the window, I might be on say Yahoo or Amazon. This morning it took (30) minutes of pain and suffering, to finally get to a desired web-site. I can no longer recommend AVG except for the xxxx pile. But the real culprit is Bill=the richest man in the world, who has come up with system that is not user friendly but a BIG piece of xxxx. Why can we not have a simple, on and off & switch, on a computer and it just works correctly and fast!! One has to be a first class fruit cake to invent a system we now have. It makes them richer as we go from Windows 1 to 9 or Vista etc. My recommendation, for us all, is to just throw all this technology ( if they want to call it that??) out the door, along with your cxx p Television, and its 3,000 commercials each day, and just to socialize with your kids, your wife, and friends. Go back to at least the '50's and enjoy life with many of the good TV shows: Like Jack Benny, Miltom Bearle, Carol Burnett, & Lucy., We now only have (7 minutes of commercials in a row) and then a few minutes of really worthless shows. What did you see last week that was any good? Absolutely nothing I would suggest. Surely, we can do better than what we are doing?? Have you seen enough commercials about drugs "to tell your Doctor" about them, the Bad lawyer commercials about all the bad drugs? What a complete waste. Unless we soon change our tombstone will read " This idiot watched 10 billion of commercials, but never met his wife and kids. Amazon, Microsoft, Bershire ended up with all money as the human race left.

Topic.Title: ChannelAdvisor Numbers Deceptive -Actually Down -40%

Message.Msg: This software was developed to give ChannelAdvisors member vendors guidance as to how their growth compares to other members and guidance as to where to market to pick up the most business. For a company like Ebay they give a general trend in growth of selling companies. However, for a company like Amazon, that is marketing its own goods against companies selling on its site, these numbers often only indicate goods that have cannibalized Amazon sales because they are used products that have been sold cheaper than Amazon can sell them. Refurbished products and used textbooks are very good examples.

Topic.Title: You would think this was a $1B company that just got the stage light

Message.Msg: Stock was at 254 the day after Q1 earnings (which were mediocre). No dramatic news from AMZN that I can think of since then (unless you count grocery delivery, the CIA deal for AWS, or the AAPL court decision). Of course, we do have Ben's comments about more QE and economy continues to slowly improve. But how does this translate to up 54 or 21%? I think there are two strategies with this stock: stay long and just hang on and enjoy the ride or try to trade it and take advantege of the ups and downs. Traders need a strong stomach though.

Topic.Title: Facebook and many other platforms don’t offer the opportunity to specifically target like offers of Local Corp with premium content

Message.Msg: Local Corporation Announces Record Mobile Search Traffic . Press Release: Local Corporation – 1 hour 31 minutes ago.. . . IRVINE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Local Corporation (LOCM), a leading online local media company, today announced record mobile search traffic for the second quarter of 2013. The company achieved mobile search traffic of 34 million monthly unique visitors (MUVs) during the second quarter 2013, up 79 percent from 19 million MUVs during the year ago period and up 6 percent from 32 million MUVs during the first quarter 2013. “With 80 percent of local searches expected to be done via a mobile device by 20181, mobile continues to reshape the local search landscape. We believe our growth in mobile illustrates that we are well-equipped for this transformation,” said Heath Clarke, Local Corporation chairman and CEO. “We are uniquely positioned with five patents issued in the mobile advertising format known as pay-per-call/mobile lead generation. We expect these will become the leading ad products for monetizing local mobile searches. With advertisers committing increasing budgets to mobile, our record mobile traffic and intellectual property represent an opportunity to capitalize on this trend.” According to BIA/Kelsey, U.S. local ad spending on mobile is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 49.3 percent, from $1.2 billion in 2012, to $9.1 billion in 2017.
